message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the convergence and generalization of artificial neural networks, which are commonly studied in the machine learning community. Specifically, the paper introduces the Neural Tangent Kernel (NTK) and proves its positive-definiteness in certain settings, which is relevant to the field of kernel methods. The paper also discusses the behavior of the NTK in the context of wide networks, which is relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of the NTK in least-squares regression, which is relevant to information theory (cs.IT). Overall, the paper's focus on neural networks and their convergence and generalization make cs.LG and cs.NE the most likely categories, followed by cs.CV, cs.AI, and cs.IT.
